intro: Ceropegia parvulior, commonly known as the miniature ceropegia or small-flowered ceropegia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is a succulent, meaning it stores water in its leaves and stems to survive in arid conditions. Ceropegia parvulior is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ability to bloom with minimal care.
